message: Try django-social-auth (https://github.com/omab/django-social-auth) — not django-socialauth, note the dashes! —and django-registration (https://bitbucket.org/ubernostrum/django-registration) — they work well together and you can also hook in django-profiles (https://bitbucket.org/ubernostrum/django-profiles) if need be too.

I was not able to get django-social-auth working. Accessing the login URL displays a static template with an error message. The docs don't give any hint what should actually go in the template, and it's mysterious to me why it ships with unfinished/useless templates. If anyone has a set of completed/working templates, would love it if you could share.
@shacker It contained a working example project last time I checked. If that's not functional, you could probably file an issue.
another one to look at is django-oauth-access. The docs are a little sparse, but it's a pretty decent library.
@micrypt Ah, thanks. I did a pip install, which doesn't give you the sample app. I'll take a look at the full dist.

The example app (as mentioned by @micrypt) is worth looking at. There's also a link to a demo app (http://social.matiasaguirre.net/) that shows a basic template and what data you can capture — it'll show a table with your id + what fields it was able to pull.
@benoitc BTW in response to your question we wrote our own stuff
Recently @pydanny @jacobburch @ptone and others here in sunny LA created http://github.com/cartwheelweb/django-la-facebook, which does FB auth via the backend (as opposed to via js)
@benoitc Try https://github.com/pennersr/django-allauth. This is the best all-in-one app so far, AFAIK.
Use django-socialauth. I've used it before and it helped out beautifully. http://theadvents.net/login-using-django-socialauth
